ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Overall, I thought this course was well taught and the material was interesting to discuss.

Great course! The energy and enthusiam of the professor was unprecedented in my experience at SOM. I learned so much from the student presentations and class discussion. Very effective seminar format. I would have liked it if we had reached climate treaties, but that is my only critique.
10: I had taken The New Corporate Social Responsibility and there was some overlap. But as Matt had indicated, the perspective here was economic rather than political science.
I enjoyed the small class size and how it was entirely discussion based.
I loved reading the journal articles and learning how to analyze them. Although it was an applied course, I think we did the right balanceof learning theories and frameworks too.
The wide range of issues discussed at class.
The directed seminar format
I liked that we had time to really discuss issues brought up in the assigned articles.
The subject matter was cutting edge
The willingness of the professor to engage with students. The openness and dialogue.
Behavioral economics and Professor Kotchen's clear explanations.
Great discussion among students. Only possible with a small number of students.

The discussion format, giving the possibility to participate with total freedom on every subject. Also, the contents of the reading posed relevant subjects to be analyzed from a theorethical and practical approach.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Some of the readings were not very exciting, a bit too much overlap with some of the studies and the lengthiness and academic approach made the readings tedious at times.Because they were long it would have helped to have a little more structure and review of the readings. It may be better to have 2 shorter classes or not so early in morning.
It felt like we just learned the same point over and over again. Really dull by the end. No incentive to do the reading.
People need to come on time :)
I would prefer more teaching from the instructor instead of just discussion.
I would have liked to see more active professor facilitation to help get the conversation going amongst the students.

Discussions were a little disjointed. It might be helpful to lump together all of the presentations at the beginning of class and then have a discussion of all of them simultaneously. Students presenting on the same day should meet to discuss the papers first and come up with a few overarching questions to kick things off. It might also be helpful to require that students submit a sentence summarizing each article to make sure students have internalized the information before coming to class.
Could use more formal explanation of complex concepts and underlying theory.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: There was no TA, and I requested very little help from the instructor as assignments and readings were clear.
Great -- Professor Kotchen was always willing to meet.
The instructor was always very helpful.
Professor Kotchen always made himself available for us during the weeks we were presenting, which I definitely appreciated.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It addressed my consumer behavioral interests and this relates to many areas of my professional/career goals. Something like this would be great to jointly teach with an SOM behavioral professor like Daylian Cain.
I am interested in environmental economics and the behavior emphasis of this course was fantastic.
This course is very much in line with my course of study; I was glad to see it offered.
Prof. was great - very responsive to emails and thoughts posed in class.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I had an interest in the topics and the small intimate class size.
I wanted to take a class at FES and I am intersted in the topic. I had heard Professor Kotchem speak at a Wednesday lunchtime seminar and was very impressed.
It's very much in line with my career interests.
I am focused on environmental economics and so I am trying to take all related courses.
Subject matter interested me and I liked the idea of a seminar style class.

I took it because it covers a variety of subjects that are related to economy and the environment and that are not studied in any other class in the Masters. For example, psychological aspects of consumers.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
not really, no.
Yes
yes

Mixed... It was interesting, and I liked the topics. I felt there was sometimes more repetition in the readings than there needed to be. The discussion also sometimes had trouble warming up, which stagnated the class a bit.
Yes
Yes, I thoroughly enjoyed the class and found it surprisingly enlightening to hear other students perspectives and experiences.
Yes
yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
I had hoped to get a bit more out of it, but I guess it was fine.
Yes
more than I expected.
See question 17.
Yes
I hoped to walk away with more frameworks or structure to apply to future analysis of similar research or case studies.
Yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't bother with the readings...
You get out of it what you put into it. Be ready to read.
Walk in expecting to - and enthusiastic to - engage in class discussion.
Make sure to participate in class early and often! Also, it goes without saying that you will not get much out of a seminar class if you don't do the reading before the class meets.
